intro: Chrysosperma, commonly known as the golden spore plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and is native to various regions in Africa and the Americas. The plants typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptability to harsh conditions. Chrysosperma species often have hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss. Their flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to their ecological significance.
